body: I have been playing this for a pretty long time now and let me tell you, this game is AWESOME!!! 100 players, last one standing wins! Even if you don't like the game, it's free so you might as well try it. I love that you are able to build in battles, or build a huge base with your friends and defend it against other players to get the win. I also like the storm slowly going over the map, pushing in all the remaining players to one small area. I also like all the different choices of weapons that you can find. From rocket launchers to pistols the choices are huge! I also like the stuff that you can get loot from. You can get loot from hot air balloons, from the ground, or you can get loot from golden chests! I most of all love the extra modes that they add in. My favorite is Playground mode where just you and your friends can build anything they want! What I don't really like is the nerf they put on shotguns and the amount of lag you can get. Overall, I think you should get it!
title: Pretty Awesome!

body: As someone who's played Minecraft for PC since it was in Beta (the Java version), I'm not quite sure how I feel about this game. When this was first released, it was PE all over again, and something I wouldn't have wanted to play. Now though, this and PE have been advanced leaps and bounds over what they were a year ago, and to my knowledge, this game has suddenly gotten a LOT of what was missing before. That said, it's still un-moddable and continues to be behind the Java counterpart for releases. Since I'm reviewing on a PC with a mouse and keyboard, my review might be biased, but I think this app is a waste for PC users. If you're using a Surface on the go or a W10 phone, this app is the only way you'll be able to play, at which point I recommend getting it. If you're a PC user, I would recommend investing more into the Java version at Minecraft.net.
title: Not sure how I feel

body: Has a lot of the exact same bugs that are in the Java version. PROS: * Very well optimised unlike its java counterpart. * Biomes are a lot larger and smoother. CONS: * Has horse armour but no horses. * Very limited graphical options. * Can't change keyboard bindings, but can change controller bindings. * Villages and pyramids are very common (Found 5 pyramids and 3 villages in my first hour, one desert). * Inventory mouse doesn't centre on open, can toss items within the inventory UI, and some pickup glitches. * Random short bursts of sprinting while walking. * No trading with villagers. * Doesn't tie to any single Java update, a lot of features and mechanics are all over the place. * Not allowed to use community texture packs, only store-bought. Although it runs well, it seems to be more catered to XBOX / Phone rather than PC. I'm not really a big fan of how this version is going. The only thing that excited me about it was optimisation, which has always been needed.
title: Below-par

body: I have seen so many posts about this being different than Java or posts like (Cliff's Large Differences post) about it looking like it was remade rather than ported. Well no duh if you were a programmer or honestly had the slightest clue about computers you would know there is a difference in programming languages. Java is based and built from C++ however it isn't C++ nor as powerful at the low levels that C++ can be. This is indeed being remade, however it has a baseline they are recoding it in C++ from the original Java source code base. This takes time and some revamping on some procedures, methods and class's. That being said the C++ version (Windows 10) is far superior in performance or at the very least will be when it is all finished. Currently it is still beta with features being added. This takes time to redo the entire codebase were talking millions of lines of code in fact at least 30% more than the original Java version. Also they are coding for virtual reality systems too.
title: Windows 10 Different than Java

body: The interface is *terrible* for PC. The not-yet-ported touch interface is so painful to use, it almost makes the game unplayable. Worst offenders: non-remappable keyboard (not everyone uses WASD, ESDF is far superior and I've died because buttons are in the wrong place), hovertext often doesn't show up or flickers and vanishes too quickly, the inventory will randomly shuffle things around, redstone isn't implemented (which wouldn't bother me so much, but that also means that) you can't make pressure plates to close gates behind you, trading with NPCs is broken...there's more. Now, it *certainly* runs better than the Java version, sometimes too well!, but without remappable keys it's a sad imitation. Keys are more important than mods, for me. And faaaaaaaaar more important than MP. What good are other players if I can't even control my character?
title: Love Minecraft, this version isn't quite there yet

body: This game is great, I've always enjoyed Minecraft's sandbox feel, and the game's performance is great on low-end hardware (and this game is on par with 1.6 on full PC game) but it is missing one critical thing that will kill this game if not fixed. Add in support for processors with x86 architecture. Why lock it down to only processors running with x64-bit architecture? Out of the five PC's I own, I can only run the game on two simply because of a single processor limitation. Please remove this Mojang, otherwise, Minecraft: Windows 10 Edition is doomed to fail.
title: Game is Nice, But Needs One Critical Thing

body: This version is basically a version of Minecraft with less features, and costs money to install texture packs. Each texture pack costs a ridiculous amount, while you could just do some searching on planetminecraft and find a texture pack that is basically the same as the ones offered in these IAPs, and download it for free. The "add ons" are basically like community maps with adventures, but there are so many good maps that already exist on planetminecraft and other sites that you can just download and install to the full version. There really aren't that many redeeming features to this version, if at all.
title: Buy the real game instead

body: First off, there are a few cool little things here and there. Like the new boat mechanics and being able to create spawners and such. However, the UI is unbearably minimalistic and awkward to navigate. I would like to have more information and options than just a few sliders and some on/off buttons. Now, as far as the control/responsiveness. This is by far my biggest complaint, it feels like I'm playing on a console, not in a good way. Although it's supposed to be the "Windows 10" version of Minecraft, this was clearly designed for a controller. Even with a Very high framerate, it still felt unresponsive at times. I will say that performance is great, until it crashes. 10 minutes in I had just found a village aaaaaand... Crash. I am currently disappointed at this attempt. It Looks like an Xbox game It Plays like an Xbox game It may as well just be a new version for Xbox. Why Windows 10? Until they make it more cross-platform compatible, I really don't see the point.
title: This is for Xbox, not PC or mobile.

body: The game doesn't include some features/aspects of the Vanilla PC release (such as mods/free texture packs/dedicated servers), but the switch from Java to C++ makes the game run far, FAR better than any previous release to date. If you are willing to overlook some feature omissions, you'll probably find this to be the most enjoyable way to play Minecraft. Also, includes full Xbox 360 Controller support!
title: Not as customizable as PC version, but better optimized

body: If it seems to good to be true- it most likely is. The Windows 10 app development environment is meant to do for the desktop/convertible/hybrid PC market what mobile apps have done for Apple & Google: extort the loyal follower base for every mod, upgrade, and "perk". Don't get me wrong, there is nothing wrong with the base game and the gameplay is FAST, CRISP, and as addictive as ever- not to mention just as developmentally appropriate for your kids :D - just don't expect the mods and other cool hacks you've learned about over the pre-MSFT years to work in this version, because they almost certainly won't. Not for a long time anyway. FEEDBACK for both MOJANG AND MSFT: Want higher ratings on this version? Support the modding community ASAP.

body: In app purchases are no good. For this reason and this reason alone I give it a 1. Nearly everything else is great or too soon in development to tell. Things are different, but that's to be expected. I love that it is clean and fast. To the developers: 1.) I don't like the z-fighting that occurs when a block is highlighted. The java version handled this perfectly using a wire-frame highlight. 2.) Particles disperse nicely except in confined spaces where they bunch up against the wall and fill the "working" screen real estate. Perhaps consider making particles smaller and causing them to bounce off walls? 3.) In app purchases. These hurt consumer confidence especially when making something based on a beloved game that was built entirely with consumer-first thinking. DON'T DO IT! 4.) So far so good; I really like it. Just don't fall into a money-first mindset. I'm sure you remember how that worked out with the Xbox One PR nightmare. I certainly do.
title: In app purchases? Real classy.

body: Let's be real here: Java is a horrible language for anything serious. Compared to more modern languages, it's inefficient and too taxing on systems. One of it's only redeeming factors is that it's easier to use cross-platform, which is why there's only one version of PC Minecraft on OSX, Windows, and *nix. While W10 edition isn't cross platform, it performs a helluva lot better because of the use of a different, more efficient language. Worlds are created and load much faster, and I get much better performance out of this version compared to the old one. 8.5/10 simply because I can play without changing allocation of resources.
title: Significantly better processing

body: I'm brand new to Minecraft. Downloaded Block Story on my tablet and Minecraft to win10 PC. My daughter really enjoys Creative mode in Minecraft, but we both play Survival in Block Story. Few primary reasons: 1. Minecraft does not have any tutorial (quests in Block Story). When you're completely new to the game, it's hard to figure out what's going on and what you're supposed to be doing without ANY tutorial... I find it very poor. Quests in BS really help you understand the game and send you off on a great adventure. 2. Recipe book is completely missing in Minecraft. I find it very handy in Block Story to explore new tools, weapons, armor options etc to conquer the next level. I'm completely lost without a recipe book in Minecraft. 3. Game controls... especially on the crafting table. For example, separating items from a stack can be a challenge. Had no issues in Block Story, but still am straggling in Minecraft. Again, tutorial would be very handy. Please, think about newbies!
title: Great game, but very hard to get going for new users

body: I liked original minecraft, meaning before the Windows 10 version. Here are a few reasons why: 1. Directx12 and not Java This is VERY important for people who don't have expensive gaming rigs. On original Minecraft there were enough options for graphics that made the game a smoother and more enjoyable experience through the power of Java. Directx12 isn't made for streamline PC'S. Meaning if all you have is your moms work laptop to read this, your out of luck. 2. Too much like mobile This game looks like it was made for tablets, from the U.I, to the controls, and to the graphics. This is just Microsofts way of saying "Well heres another uncompleted version of a game you've been waiting for, for the past 3 years," And 3. You have to pay for the beta* Really? $10 for a beta? I mean its not that bad but if your new to minecraft this isn't the way to start. It will most likely be another $30 for the full game anyways! So unless you already own Minecraft on PC, DONT GET IT!

body: I've attempted to return countless times, for the past few weeks, to play this game. I was able to run this game for a short amount of time when I originally upgraded to Windows 10, it has since been updated to 0.12.1. After the update, I went into the settings and selected full screen mode and the game froze. Since then, every time I load the game I get an immediate freeze upon seeing the title screen. It allows me hear music and select either 'Options' or 'Play' while clicking other menus does nothing. When I enter either of the two accessible menus, the background spins normally, music play, and that's all. Clicking or highlighting anything further will cause the game to freeze while the music still plays. I would love to play this game and buy a second copy to play alongside my S/O but this is strongly halting me from doing so. TL:DR - Don't select full screen and avoid picking this up unless you are willing to beta test a broken game or it's free.

body: Can't pause the game. It keeps running, even when I'm in the ESC menu. Can't change the resolution. Can't use my old save files. Everything feels clunky with the keyboard and mouse. It kind of feels like they just ported over the Xbox version, where you're supposed to use the controller. It works, but it feels very disconnected from my inputs. There's this weird thing with my view. Maybe it's a result of the poor (and unchangeable) resolution. The view is either too close, or I get this weird, shimmery, fish-eye effect where everything I can focus on is both too sharp and too far away, and everything else is in perpetual motion blur, even if I'm not moving. It makes me nauseous, and there's no happy medium between the two. All in all, absolutely hate this version.

I start up my dune buggy and make my way through the woods until suddenly, my screen turns black and sends me back to the Xbox Home screen. I attempt to join back in the match and find myself dead due to my exposed vehicle. The amount of times I have had my game crash is absurd. Video games are for me to be entertained not stressed out. I have also experienced a bug to where I can not scroll through my inventory and causes me to not aquire most of the loot I need in order to survive. Another thing that would make the game easier to play would be the amount of time it takes for buildings and other objects to load in. It sometimes traps me in walls eventually killing me. The game needs more effort from all game producers because future games will run this game over with a truck. Thanks for your attention.

So, between the rubber banding, XBOX locking up, pixelating, and the endless time wasted getting back in a game to find out you have been snuffed out. So much needs to be done. It is online play only(no campaign) You do have option to single, duo, or s/quad play. It does have a BIG map and what I hear , after fully complete there will be 3. So, lots of learning.
